bibl.title: Letter from Richard Roley to Philip Showalter Hench, March 22, 1948

div1.p: Roley writes that he is delighted to send the original Cornwell painting for the Fourth International Congress on Tropical Medicine. He notes in a postscript that the painting should probably be sent to Dart, and so will send him a copy of this letter.

div1.head: Letter from Richard Roley to Philip Showalter Hench, March 22, 1948
div1.opener:
WYETH
I N C O R P O R A T E D
A Complete Pharmaceutical, Biological and Nutritional Service
1600 ARCH STREET
PHILADELPHIA 3, PA.
March 22, 1948
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Mr. Law has told me of your interest in the original of
the painting, “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” for the
Fourth International Congress on Tropical Medicine to
be held in Washington the week of May 10th to 18th. We
should be delighted to send you the painting for that
occasion and are grateful for your suggesting it.

If it would be possible for you to let me know exactly
to whom the painting should be shipped, we will take care
of that. We have, as you may know, special crates for
the shipment of our paintings to guard against damage
and they are insured on a blanket policy so shipping
“Conquerors of Yellow Fever” will be both convenient
and a pleasure.

About Dr. Fitz' talk on the Oliver Wendell Holmes painting -
we had planned to publish it but Dr. Fitz wanted to use it
in an issue of the Alumni Bulletin of the Harvard Medical
College. I am not quite sure that that is the name of the
publication, but it was published along with a reproduction
of the painting. If you would like to see a copy, I shall
try to get one, or perhaps you would rather write direct to
Dr. Fitz.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, Richard Roley
Advertising Manager cc: Mr. Law
Colonel Dart
P.S. I note in your letter to Mr. Law that in all probability
the painting should go to Colonel Dart at the Army Institute
of Pathology. Therefore I am sending a copy of my letter to
you to Colonel Dart so that if he is interested in obtaining
the original of “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”, he will send
us shipping instructions.
Wyeth
U.S.
